info.name: Printify API
info.description:
Points of contact and inquiry
=============================

- [rostislav@printify.com](mailto:rostislav@printify.com) Project Manager.
- [apiteam@printify.com](mailto:apiteam@printify.com) API Technical Team.

## Getting started

Printify API enables you to automate product and order creation for a variety of scenarios,
including integration with your on-site design generator, on-site product customization and more.

item.name: List of variants options for the Print Provider and Blueprint

request.description:
Retrieves the list of of variants options for the Print Provider and Blueprint.
    Those form the set of options available for customization Product (BluepRint)
    on particular manufacturer (Print Provider).
     *

item.name: Submit and register Pull Orders Data Feed URL

request.description:
Submit and register Pull Orders Data Feed URL For now, we require Sales Channel to provide Printify with Pull Orders Data Feeds. This is currently the only option to submit (via pull) Orders to Printify. Some (representative, not comprehensive) reasons why to: - to provide uniform and consistent UX across the whole platfrom (e.g. Order Import etc). - to re-try order processing on a need basis (e.g. troubleshooting or catching up downtime time)... ## Testing Pull Orders Data Feeds from Printify Once the Pull Orders Data Feed have been registered, you should be able to request troubleshooting logs to verify the status. Example of the sucessfull report: > Registering Pull Orders Data Feed 'https://yourdomain.com/v1/printify-api/store/1234/orders-pull.json' (basic auth='user1:{masked}')
GET 'https://yourdomain.com/v1/printify-api/store/1234/orders-pull.json?limit=1' (basic auth='user1:{masked}') = 200 (Ok)
Ok: Pull Orders Data Feed registered succesfully. Example of the problem report: > Registering Pull Orders Data Feed 'https://yourdomain.com/v1/printify-api/store/1234/orders-pull.json' (basic auth='user1:{masked}')
GET 'https://yourdomain.com/v1/printify-api/store/1234/orders-pull.json?limit=1' (basic auth='user1:{masked}') = 404 (Not Found)
Error: Pull Orders Data Feed cound not be registered. ## Securing your Data Feeds The authentication parameters are submitted as part of the installation process. You may choose to: - authenticate based on basic auth (user + password). - authenticate based on headers values (token name + token value). - or combination from the above. ⚠ Caution: Please be aware we will be storing that information in Printify database in salted (per sales channel and merchant) form. However please make sure you have made all the necessary steps to secure the secrets on your end, plus to easily rotate on a need basis. ⚠ We highly recommend to always use valid and properly set up TLS-enable HTTP layer (RE: [Mozilla Server Side TLS Guide](https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS)).

response.name: Pull Orders Data Feed URL has been accepted
